newsitem.title: BOLIVIA: SOCCER-ETCHEVERRY KEEPS BOLIVIA HOPES ALIVE.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-ETCHEVERRY KEEPS BOLIVIA HOPES ALIVE.

text.p: A perfectly executed free kick by Marco Etcheverry gave Bolivia a 1-0 win over Uruguay on Sunday and kept alive their faint hopes of qualifying for the World Cup.
But the result was a disaster for the Uruguayans who began the day eighth in the nine-team South American group with 14 points from 11 games.

Etcheverry chipped a free kick over the Uruguayan wall and into the top corner in the 75th minute to end an afternoon of suffering for Bolivia, who dominated the match but could not turn their superiority into goals.

Uruguay arrived ten days before the game to acclimatise to the altitude of La Paz, 3,600 metres above sea level. Despite their need for a win, they showed no interest in attacking and veteran midfielder Enzo Francescoli was substituted early in the second half.
Bolivia's headache is that they play their remaining four games away from home.
